definition: worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker

sentences.english: It is likely, however, that the Magi were familiar with the great Messianic prophesies .
sentences.chinese: 這是有可能，但是，賢士熟悉偉大救世主的預言。

sentences.english: These are the three wise men.
Girdle of the Warrior Magi now has a socket bonus .
sentences.chinese: 腰帶的戰士賢士現在有一個插座的獎金。

sentences.english: They asked the talents to serve the society.
sentences.chinese: 然後再要求這些賢士出來爲社會服務。

sentences.english: The Magi reached Bethlehem because they had obediently allowed themselves to be guided by the star.
sentences.chinese: 賢士們來到了白冷，因爲他們順從異星的指引。

definition: Yue state/generic term for states in south China or southeast Asia at different historical periods
Xiao He (-193 BC), famous strategist and chancellor, fought on Liu Bang's 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] side during the Chu-Han Contention 楚漢戰爭|楚汉战争[Chu3 Han4 Zhan4 zheng1]
deep roots and vigorous foliage (idiom)/(fig.) well established and growing strongly
the five Confucian relationships (ruler-subject, father-son, brother-brother, husband-wife, friend-friend)
(old) candidate who has successfully passed the first grades of the examination system, but not yet the court examination (殿試|殿试[dian4 shi4])
